snippet: President Xi Jinping’s crackdown on corruption has a new target: the popular capitalist pastime of golf, derided by Mao as a rich man’s game.
abstract: Golf emerges as latest target of Chinese Pres Xi Jinping's wide-ranging crackdown on corruption; government sets up hotline to report golf-related gambling, conflicts of interest and bribery; sport became prime target due to its association with Western capitalism.

byline.contributor: Vanessa Piao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping’s crackdown on corruption has a new target: the popular capitalist pastime of golf, derided by Mao as a rich man’s game.

headline.main: China Cracks Down on Golf, the ‘Sport for Millionaires’
headline.print_headline: China’s Crackdown on Corruption Targets Those Who Like to Tee Off
